html: “Hello,” said the spider. “‘Shelob’ is my name.”
markdown:
"Hello," said the spider.
"'Shelob' is my name."

html: ‘Oak,’ ‘elm,’ and ‘beech’ are names of trees. So is ‘pine.’
markdown:
'Oak,' 'elm,' and 'beech' are names of trees.
So is 'pine.'

html: Here is some quoted ‘code’ and a “quoted link”.
markdown: Here is some quoted '`code`' and a "[quoted link](url)".

html: ‘We’ll use Jane’s boat and John’s truck,’ Jenna said.
markdown: 'We'll use Jane's boat and John's truck,' Jenna said.

html:
“A paragraph with no closing quote.

“Second paragraph by same speaker, in fiction.”
markdown:
"A paragraph with no closing quote.

"Second paragraph by same speaker, in fiction."

html: "This is not smart." This isn't either. 5'8"
markdown:
\"This is not smart.\"
This isn\'t either.
5\'8\"

html: Some dashes: em—em en–en em — em en – en 2–3
markdown:

en--en
em --- em
en -- en
